ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Dose taken by subject when the target symptom rating was performed
Target symptom 1 (text has been cleared of identifiers)
Average numeric rating assigned Target Symptom 1 by blinded raters.
Notes: Each blinded rater assessed the frequency and severity of the target symptom compared to the baseline, frequency, and severity. Then assigned a numeric rating.

ElementDescription: Target symptom 2 (text has been cleared of identifiers)
Average numeric rating assigned Target Symptom 2 by blinded raters.
Notes: Each blinded rater assessed the frequency and severity of the target symptom compared to the baseline, frequency, and severity. Then assigned a numeric rating.
1= Mother; 2= Grandmother; 3= Guardian, female; 4= Other female; 5= Father; 6= Grandfather; 7= Guardian, male; 8= Other male; 9= Other

-1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits
